reviewText: I love Don Knotts.  He could just stand there and I would laugh.  All of the movies are funny and well done.  Great family movie.

A decent set of movies featuring Don Knotts, comic actor legend.  The movies vary in humor and quality, and are the usual fare for 1970's Disney.  It's a bargain. I actually saw all the films offered in this set at the theatre, and they bring back some good memories.  Some of the films are better than others, and perhaps are not up to the production standards of today's more aesthetically appealing family films from Disney and other studios.

The Apple Dumpling Gang is a good family film, the Return of the Apple Dumpling Gang is a bit adult for a Disney film.  Hot Lead and Cold Feet has some good moments in it, and GUS the field kicking donkey brings back some good memories of seeing the film in the theatre.

Like I say, they're older films, so they're going to have some shortcomings.  They're not exactly low budget, but they're not exactly the high gloss product that Disney cranks out today, though still visually respectable.

But hey, for the price of one film you get four.  If you're a Disney fan or grew up during the 70s and remember these films, then maybe splurge on a set.

Don Knotts 4 Movie Collection  Disney

In general, this is a collection of very poor efforts by the producers. None of these movies comes even close to using the comic talents and genius of their respective stars. In a nutshell, these were just four attempts to capitalize on the stars names.

In the two Apple Dumpling movies, the (allegedly) featured stars, Knotts and Tim Conway, are barely even connected to the main story line. Their chief purpose is to provide worn out food-in-the-face, crash-through-the-window, make-goofy-faces gags. And at that, the story line of the original Apple Dumpling Gang is pretty close to James Garners Support Your Local Sheriff.

In the Hot Lead/Cold Feet movie, Knotts and Jack Elam seem like boring clips from some other movie accidentally included in the main film.

In Gus, the star (Knotts) doesnt spend 10 minutes in view and does nothing but make goofy faces and short silly statements when he is in front of the camera.

Whatever you pay for this, it will be twice as much as you should pay.

The 1st Apple Dumpling Gang movie is FAR AND AWAY our favorite from this set.  It completely uses the talents of Tim Conway and Don Knotts to their fullest potential.  Not to mention the others in that cast - Harry Morgan, Bill Bixby, etc.  We watched Gus 1st.  We had never seen it before.  For such an all star cast, the comic talents of Don & Tim were TOTALLY under utilized.  The plot was typical Disney for that time period and the video effects were definitely not up to today's standards.  It was ok and we might watch it again on a rainy day in the future, but so glad this was NOT the movie we "paid for" from this set.  Likewise Hot Lead/Cold Feet is typical Disney.  Quite a bit better than Gus, but not A.D.G.  No Tim in this one and Don again was not used for what we watch Don Knotts for!  The wholesome theme and values were refreshing.  In our PC era now, my wife and I had to laugh that the gun fights - including the kids - would give heart palpitations to those outside our midwest/NRA area! :)  Totally worth it for the package, but not so much for the non-A.D.G.'s in this boxed set.

I remember sitting in the front seat of my parents' 1962 Chevrolet station wagon watching Don Knotts and Tim Conway on the big screen at my hometown's drive in theater, laughing at their silly antics. Years later, the duo appeared yet again, this time in my family's living room via VHS tape, helping my husband and me convince our four sons that family movie night could be a lot of fun and that Batman and Superman did not need to be the headliners. It did not take long until our boys actually looked forward to "movie night" and even asked what "old" movies my husband and I would find next.

A few weeks ago I happened across this collection and ordered it on a whim. The humor and talent of this team to this day do not disappoint. This comedy duo can still bring our boys (now in their twentys) together into the living room to laugh at the exact same scenes I did when I was a child.

I figure it won't be too long from now that my husband and I will once again pull these movies out and convince our grandkids that old movies can be fun and Batman and Superman do not need to be the headliners.

and gives Knotts & Conway starring roles in the the 2nd "Apple Dumpling Rides Again."

I think in "Gus" Knotts appears less & not as funny.
Tim Conway in "Gus" is teamed up w/ Tom Bosely and never appears w/ Knotts. How can Disney do that! It's like
separating Abbott & Costello, Laurel & Hardy, Andy & Barney.
